Following a ModCom recommendation the commission, which operates under the jurisdiction of the Committee on House Administration, released updated standards to ensure greater transparency and accessibility in official communications in the 116th Congress.

The First Continental Congress instituted the franking privilege to help representatives better communicate with constituents via mailed correspondence.

Today, the commission continues to regulate this correspondence in the form of postal mail, digital advertisements, & more.
